result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas G. Korb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas G. Korb is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas G. Korb was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Thomas G. Korb was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes: *Report clean & sober.  *Electronic Monitoring will be allowed after 30 days of serving the jail time if the defendant complies with all jail policies.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas G. Korb

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Court from T. Cassidy-Green Lake Co DHHS
on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation s/BNB/7-28-17
MARQUETTE COUNTY DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION

Defendant Thomas G. Korb in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 3.  Count 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Bolles agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 3. Count 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Bolles makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 1 & 3:  Withhold Sentence; 18 months Probation with conditions:
*45 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on Ct. 1
  Report on or before July 1, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Credit = 0 days
*Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge on each count
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Electronic Monitoring will be allowed after 30 days of serving the jail time if the defendant complies with all jail policies
Count 2 to be dismissed.
Plea hearing on May 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Thomas G. Korb in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he and Atty Bolles have had discussion on resolution and an offer was provided.  Atty Bolles states that the parties are close to resolution and asks for a Status.  Atty Bolles states that the defendant is seeking treatment.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Telephone Status.
bond continued.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's authorization for attorney to appear and act

Defendant Thomas G. Korb in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties will most likely be asking for a reset to give time for a pre-trial.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas G. Korb in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court finds probable cause.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

$1047.50 posted for warrant on 13 FO 40 &
$450.00 for this new criminal case
